definition: variant of 復原|复原[fu4 yuan2]
to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out
currency unit (esp. Chinese yuan)/first/original/primary/fundamental/constituent/part/era (of a reign)/meta- (prefix)/(math.) argument/variable/(Tw) (geology) eon
surname Yuan/the Yuan or Mongol dynasty (1279-1368)

sentences.english: The way to get recovery is to let business alone.
sentences.chinese: 復元的方法是要讓商業機構獨立。
快速從骨痛熱症恢復元氣。

sentences.english: And in My quiet strength again be strong.
sentences.chinese: 在我寧靜的力量中恢復元氣。

sentences.english: It will be a long recovery and we are doing what we can here.
sentences.chinese: 要復元需要很長的時間，我們在這裏能做到甚麼便做。

sentences.english: The patient rallied after the operation.
sentences.chinese: 病人經過手術後身體復元了。

sentences.english: He recovered slowly after his long illness.
Reinforces the body's ability to recover after sickness.
sentences.chinese: 加速身體病癒後的復元能力。

sentences.english: And Japan's economy promptly fell off a cliff and has never recovered.
sentences.chinese: 結果日本經濟馬上跌下懸崖，從未恢復元氣。

sentences.english: Our firm has recuperated after financial losses.
sentences.chinese: 我們的公司在財務虧損之後現已恢復元氣。

definition: intensive care
brain death
bedsore
to transfer (a patient) to a different hospital/to transfer to hospital (e.g. a prisoner)
see 生命體徵|生命体征[sheng1 ming4 ti3 zheng1]
Shenkang township in Changhua county 彰化縣|彰化县[Zhang1 hua4 xian4], Taiwan
nursing home/hospice
Wuxi prefecture level city in Jiangsu
neurosurgery
to be present during childbirth
